common_issues.title: Pieces OS and extensions exhibit unexpected behavior
common_issues.description: Users report issues with Pieces OS including persistent selection mode, high resource usage, and Raycast extension incompatibility.  The selection bug involves unintended selection behavior, possibly related to shift/mouse click lock. High resource usage involves RAM/CPU spikes, potentially linked to internet connectivity.  The Raycast extension issue stems from version incompatibility.  Suggested solutions include restarting Pieces OS and updating the Raycast extension.

related_issues.title: it doesnt stop selecting, it seems like "shift" or "mouse 1" is locked
related_issues.text:
it doesnt stop selecting, it seems like "shift" or "mouse 1" is locked
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

4.3.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I'm not sure how to make it happen but its **extremely** annoying, it seems like it thinks I'm holding "shift" or "mouse 1", i use the arrow keys a lot but when this bug is active it selects instead of moving, when i try to click when its active it also selects, i cant ctrl + v when its active :(

related_issues.title: PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
Several users have called in recently about Pieces using too much RAM or causing a spike in CPU up to 100%. We are trying to track down this issue, and would appreciate any feedback about your experience with this if you are experiencing it. 

We have a hunch it has something to do with internet connections, but aren't fully sure yet. 

If you're experiencing this and wouldn't mind hopping on a call with us to show us, we would really appreciate it to help us troubleshoot! You can schedule a call [here](https://calendar.google.com/calendar/u/0/appointments/schedules/AcZssZ2iaRWpd1kA2k_xg2KrVi_jiTHo0POiMZSI9WAYsxs5jJ9sU2Rd2zKitLuSFd7l3FhatGzy5Vgt
). 

A short-term solution is to restart PiecesOS whenever this occurs.

related_issues.title: Raycast Extension Incompatible with Current Version of Raycast
related_issues.text:
Raycast Extension Incompatible with Current Version of Raycast


### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Raycast Extension

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

12.1.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

As mentioned on Discord, it appears that the Raycast needs to be updated to be compatible with (at least) the current version of Raycast 1.100.3. Trying to use any of the extension's functions triggers an error saying:

> Your Pieces Raycast Extension needs to be updated,...

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/506778e6-5b13-4811-a21c-82c42384cb41)
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

recommendations: Investigate and address the root cause of the "selection lock" bug reported in ticket #803.
Investigate and address the high RAM/CPU usage issue reported in ticket #150, focusing on the potential connection with internet connectivity.
Update the Raycast extension to ensure compatibility with the latest Raycast version as reported in ticket #781.
Proactively monitor and address issues related to Pieces OS and its extensions to prevent recurrence.
